info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 23 at 5:38AM PST until December 27 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 2000 feet, snow expected. New snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, except up to 6 inches above 3000 foot elevations. For the Winter Storm Watch, periods of moderate to heavy snow is likely. Total additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph, at times, in exposed locations. * WHERE...Eastern Douglas County Foothills including Highway 138 east of Roseburg and the towns of Steamboat and Toketee Falls. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday morning through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible during the winter storm watch period. Today, the hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will lower in showers today with minor impacts possible. The winter storm watch period will bring significant impacts, at times, to include potential road closures. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
